definitions.definition: Darkness where light , particularly sunlight , is blocked .
examples: The old oak tree gave shade in the heat of the day. The temperature rised to the 40 degrees Celsius in the shade .

definitions.definition: Something that blocks light, particularly in a window .
examples: Close the shade , please: it's too bright in here.

definitions.definition: A variety of a color, in particular one obtained by adding black (compare tint ).
examples: I've painted my room in five lovely shades of pink and chartreuse.

definitions.definition: A subtle variation in a concept.
An aspect that is reminiscent of something.
A very small degree of a quantity, or variety of meaning
A ghost or specter ; a spirit .
examples: Too long have I been haunted by that shade .
The adventurer was attacked by a shade .

definitions.definition: A postage stamp showing an obvious difference in colour/color to the original printing and needing a separate catalogue/catalog entry.

examples: Why did you paint your room chartreuse? No shade ; I'm genuinely curious.

definitions.definition: A cover around or above a light bulb, a lampshade .

main_definition: ( uncountable ) Darkness where light , particularly sunlight , is blocked .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) Something that blocks light, particularly in a window .
( countable ) A variety of a color, in particular one obtained by adding black (compare tint ).
( figuratively ) A subtle variation in a concept.
( figuratively , in the plural ) An aspect that is reminiscent of something.
A very small degree of a quantity, or variety of meaning
( chiefly literary and fantasy ) A ghost or specter ; a spirit .
( countable ) A postage stamp showing an obvious difference in colour/color to the original printing and needing a separate catalogue/catalog entry.
( uncountable , originally LGBTQ slang ) Subtle insults.
( countable ) A cover around or above a light bulb, a lampshade .
